result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Patrick Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today April 3, 2015 by 3:15 p.m.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF241.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF241

-Cooperate with any assessment or program requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
Not to use or possess firearms.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Jennifer Anne Bork   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Michael Patrick Crowe appeared. Case called at 2:26 pm. There is an agreement. Atty Caton recites. No objection from the State. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of Count 1. Parties make sentencing arguements. Court orders: 
2 years Probation
- Court Costs
-  120 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA and recommendations
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation
- Cooperate with any assessment or program requested by Agent
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
 - Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Not to possess a firearm
- Subject to Rand UA's and PBT's
- Report to Probation by April 3rd, 2015 at 3:15 pm
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Plea hearing on April 3, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
